intro: Draba aizoides subsp. zahlbruckneri, commonly known as the alpine winter cress, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a small herbaceous species with basal leaves and a flowering stem that bears clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in mountainous environments. It has a compact growth habit and is adapted to cold climates, flowering in early spring. Its botanical features include a short, hairy stem and small, spoon-shaped leaves.
